description:
Erection of a two storey side extension to create a self
contained dwelling; the erection of a part two storey rear
addition and the conversion of the rear garages to a gym,
including the replacement of the flat roof with a pitch roof
As shown on drawing numbers Site Location Plan, 06.592.10,
11C, 12C, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17C, 18C, 19A
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - No windows or other openings shall be formed in the side
    (west) elevation of the extensions hereby approved without
    the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Condition : 3 - The gymnasium use hereby permitted shall only be used by the
    occupants of the new dwelling hereby approved as a
    gymnasium, incidental to the enjoyment of the property as a
    single family dwelling house within Class C3 of the Schedule
    of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987.

Condition : 4 - Full details of the proposed roof lights and front elevation
    treatment to the gymnasium building hereby approved shall be
    submitted and approved in writing prior to the commencement
    of the development.

Condition : 5 - Full details of the internal arrangements to both the lower
    ground and ground floor flats as a result of the demolition
    of the existing side addition and part rear extension hereby
    approved shall be submitted and approved in writing prior to
    the commencement of the development.

Condition : 6 - The new windows in the development hereby approved shall be
    painted timber, double hung vertical sash window and all
    external joinery shall also be painted timber and hip roof
    to the side extension and gymnasium shall be completed in
    natural slate.

Condition : 7 - Landscape details of the open space on the western side of
    the side extension hereby approved adjoining the rear
    gardens of Winchester Road including the provision of
    replacement trees shall be submitted and approved in writing
    prior to the commencement of development and shall be laid
    out and completed within 12 months of the completion of the
    side extension, or 12 months of occupation of the new
    dwelling hereby approved.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN22, EN13 and EN31 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To protect the privacy and amenity of occupiers of adjoining
    residential properties.

Condition : 10 - To protect the amenities of the area and to prevent
    sub-division or use of the property as a separate unit of
    residential accommodation.

Condition : 11 - To ensure a satifactory appearance for the development and
    in the interest of visual amenity and the character and
    appearance of the Conservation area.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice
    the living condition of the occupants of 148 Fellows Road.

Condition : 13 - To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the development and
    in the interest of visual amenity and character and
    appearance of the Conservation Area.

Condition : 14 - To ensure a satisfactory open space provision and in the
    interest of visual amenity and the character and appearance
    of the Conservation Area.

Condition : 15 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring
    residential properties no construction work of this
    permission shall be carried out on or before 8 am or after 6
    pm Monday to Friday inclusive, before 9 am or after 1 pm on
    Saturday and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 16 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted  Development Order) 1995 or any Order revoking  and re-enacting that Order, no development within Part 1 (Classes A-H) [and Part 2 (Classes A-C)] of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be carried out without the grant of planning permission having first been obtained from the Council.

Reason: To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to prevent over development of the site by controlling proposed extensions and alterations
in order to ensure compliance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to prevent
    over development of the site by controlling proposed
    extensions and alterations in order to ensure compliance
    with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
